---
title: "cloud_missing_port.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines settings for a server and experimental features, specifically related to cloud functionality. It enables cloud features for both the server and experimental sections but lacks a port configuration for the server.

## Symbols

### `server`
#### Description
The `server` section contains configuration settings related to the server component of the application.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines a nested `cloud` section with an `enabled` flag set to `true`.

### `server.cloud`
#### Description
This subsection specifies cloud-related settings for the server.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Indicates whether cloud functionality is enabled for the server |

### `experimental`
#### Description
The `experimental` section contains configuration settings for features that are still in the experimental phase.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines a nested `cloud` section with an `enabled` flag set to `true`.

### `experimental.cloud`
#### Description
This subsection specifies cloud-related settings for experimental features.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Indicates whether experimental cloud functionality is enabled |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| server.cloud.enabled | boolean | true | Enables cloud functionality for the server |
| experimental.cloud.enabled | boolean | true | Enables experimental cloud functionality |

## TODOs
The filename "cloud_missing_port.yml" suggests that this configuration is intentionally missing a port setting, which might be required for proper server configuration. This could be used as a test case to verify how the application handles incomplete cloud server configurations.
